timeline.author: highker

replies.bodyText: I thought about it and then felt this would impact how the Driver works so it is more than a context. But since we already have plan in the context, maybe it does not hurt to put these into context as well. I'll take a look.
replies.author: shixuan-fan

timeline.bodyText: Since this cache is on the driver's side, is there any sanity check in protection from oom? just curious if this cache size can be stored for monitoring so caching on the driver is in a controlled manner.
timeline.author: fgwang7w

replies.bodyText:
Good point. FragmentResultCacheManager would be a singleton on each Presto worker, and cache instrumentation would be  part of the FragmentResultCacheManager implementation (which is still work-in-progress).
Currently the plan is to store the map keys (plan-split pair) in memory and actual result pages in local disk. We should be able to set configuration to limit the cache entries so that we could keep memory usage in check.
replies.author: shixuan-fan

timeline.bodyText: Maybe add a comment to explain we don't we need the whole stack of variables
timeline.author: highker

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/presto-hive/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/hive/HiveTableLayoutHandle.java b/presto-hive/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/hive/HiveTableLayoutHandle.java
index 63aebcf69c..e7f1a1a99d 100644
--- a/presto-hive/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/hive/HiveTableLayoutHandle.java
+++ b/presto-hive/src/main/java/com/facebook/presto/hive/HiveTableLayoutHandle.java

@@ -230,6 +230,10 @@ public final class HiveTableLayoutHandle
     @Override
     public Object getIdentifier()
     {
+        // Identifier is used to identify if the table layout is providing the same set of data.
+        // To achieve this, we need table name, data column predicates and bucket filter.
+        // We did not include other fields because they are either table metadata or partition column predicate,
+        // which is unrelated to identifier purpose, or has already been applied as the boundary of split.
         return ImmutableMap.builder()
                 .put("schemaTableName", schemaTableName)
                 .put("domainPredicate", domainPredicate)

timeline.bodyText: We have a lot of CanonicalXXX counter part in this commit. Shall we add some tests to make sure the canonical part is in sync with the original class? Meaning that if the original class changes, we should fail some tests or automatically fix the CanonicalXXX
timeline.author: highker

replies.bodyText: Great idea. Let me try to add some tests for this.
replies.author: shixuan-fan

replies.bodyText: Added some field assertion tests in TestCanonicalPlanGenerator

replies.bodyText:
I'll rename it to FragmentCacheStats. There are two reasons:

The fields actually are different, and quotaExceed might not make sense for FragmentCacheStats.
presto-common and presto-main are independent and I don't want to introduce this dependency, unless we want to move this to spi.
replies.author: shixuan-fan

timeline.bodyText: put it into finally incase tryDeleteFile directly throws
timeline.author: highker
highker

replies.bodyText:
No AggregationNode?

AggregationNode is a bit different and right now we require it to be the root in isEligibleForFragmentResultCaching. ALLOWED_NODES here is for the children of AggregationNode. I'll rename this constant to ALLOWED_CHILDREN_NODES

Set<Class<? extends PlanNode>>

Good point :)
